title: Tekna (Norway)
text:
Tekna (short for "Teknisk-naturvitenskapelig forening", ) is a <a href="Trade%20union">union</a> for graduate technical and scientific professionals in <a href="Norway">Norway</a>.
History and profile.
It was established in 1874 under the name "Den Norske Ingeniør- og Arkitektforening" ('the Norwegian Engineer and Architect Association'). In 1912 it was reorganized as "Den Norske Ingeniørforening" ('the Norwegian Engineer Association'). It was again renamed to "Norske Sivilingeniørers Forening" ('Civil Engineers' Association of Norway') in 1973, and to Tekna in 2004.
It has 77,000 members as of 2019. The headquarters are in <a href="Oslo">Oslo</a>. It publishes "<a href="Teknisk%20Ukeblad">Teknisk Ukeblad</a>" together with NITO.
Tekna is a member of the <a href="Federation%20of%20Norwegian%20Professional%20Associations">Federation of Norwegian Professional Associations</a>, Nording (the Scandinavian association of engineering organisations), and Nordic IN. Its president is Lise Lyngsnes Randeberg.
